name: Madan Fort (Madangad)
difficulty: Hard (technical, strenuous, exposed sections requiring ropes/ladders)
duration: 9–12 hours (one way, including approach and full exploration); often done as part of the AMK (Alang–Madangad–Kulang) circuit over 2–3 days
description: Madangad is a challenging hill fort famous for its vertical rock faces, iron ladders, and breathtaking views of the Sahyadri region. The fort is part of the renowned AMK trio, known for technical climbs, exposed ledges, and cave camping. It attracts experienced trekkers seeking adventure, technical sections, and rugged wilderness. The trail involves steep ascents with technical aids and requires strong navigation skills.

startingPoint.name: Ambewadi Village (primary), Ghatghar Village (alternative)
startingPoint.description: Ambewadi is the standard base for Madangad, accessible via Ghoti or Kasara. Ghatghar can be used for alternate circuits and offers slightly better facilities.

networkAvailability.emergencyContact: Dial 108 or 112 if network is available; carry satellite phone or notify local contacts before trek.

restaurants: Homestays providing home-cooked meals on prior arrangement

waterSources: Limited; carry minimum 3 liters per person
Rock pools and caves may have water; treat before consumption
foodOptions: No food stalls on trek; carry packed food

facilities: Natural cisterns (water quality varies; advisable to treat)
recommendations: Carry water purification tablets or filters
No food availability; pack all needed supplies

locations: Caves on top of Madangad Fort
facilities: No official campsites; campers must be self-sufficient
camping.cost: Free; bring own tents and camping gear

permits.timings: Entry advised before noon; avoid entering after sunset. Camping allowed with village knowledge.

commonRisks: Technical rock climbs requiring ropes and ladders
Limited water availability in dry season
precautions: Trek with experienced guides familiar with AMK route
Carry first aid kits and safety harnesses
Avoid monsoon or bad weather conditions
rescuePoints: Base of Kulang Fort (for AMK circuit)

monsoon.conditions: Heavy rain, slippery rocks, leeches, fog, high risk
monsoon.recommendation: Only for highly experienced teams; avoid in strong rains

trekRoute.difficulty: High; technical rock climbs, exposed traverses
